title: Charles Pinckney National Historic Site: Park Home
body: The Forgotten Founder  Charles Pinckney was a principal author and a signer of the United States Constitution. This remnant of his coastal plantation is preserved to tell the story of a "forgotten founder," his life of public service, the lives of enslaved African Americans on South Carolina Lowcountry plantations and their influences on Charles Pinckney.                Visit the Park   Plan Your Visit to Historic Snee Farm.        Charles Pinckney and Snee Farm   Learn about Charles Pinckney and his Lowcountry plantation, Snee Farm.              Become a Junior Ranger   Kids of all ages get the chance to become a Junior Ranger at Charles Pinckney National Historic Site through special activities.         Volunteers In Parks   Learn what you can do to become a volunteer at Charles Pinckney National Historic Site and Charleston-area National Park Sites.        Learn about educational field trips   Contact the park to find out what activities are available for school groups visiting Charles Pinckney National Historic Site.
